This is the basic care plan for your chocobo. Under this plan, we will provide for your chocobo's most fundamental needs.${prompt}
You can choose to give your chocobo a long rest. This will revitalize its energy and accelerate its recovery from injury or illness.${prompt}
We can take your chocobo out on a walk through the safe areas of town. This should improve its physical condition.${prompt}
Listening to music will make your chocobo a more refined creature, and should improve its mental condition.${prompt}
Exercising alone will improve your chocobo's strength, but will have a slightly negative effect on its mental condition.${prompt}
Exercising in a group will improve your chocobo's stamina, but will have a slightly negative effect on its mental condition.${prompt}
Interacting with children will improve your chocobo's intelligence, but will have a slightly negative effect on its physical condition.${prompt}
Interacting with other chocobos will improve your chocobo's receptivity, but will have a slightly negative effect on its physical condition.${prompt}
You can earn some money by having your chocobo deliver packages for the guilds.${prompt}
Carrying heavy loads will improve its physical condition, but will inflict a certain amount of stress on the animal.${prompt}
You can exhibit your chocobo to the public. We will provide you with a monetary token of gratitude for this service.${prompt}
Interacting with the public will improve its mental condition, but will inflict a certain amount of stress on the animal.${prompt}
You can send your chocobo to deliver official messages. The nation will compensate you for your services.${prompt}
Carrying someone on its back for a long period of time will build strength in your chocobo's legs, but will place some strain on the animal.${prompt}
You can send your chocobo to dig for items to benefit the stables. We will thank you for your contribution with a certain amount of gil.${prompt}
Digging for treasure will improve your chocobo's intelligence, but will place some strain on the animal and may decrease its stamina.${prompt}
Your chocobo can even appear in plays. This will require your chocobo to perform simple acts and will improve its receptivity.${prompt}
You will receive a gil payment for this service, but appearing in a play will have a negative effect on the animal's strength and will place some strain on your chocobo.${prompt}

The Vana'diel Chocobo Society, or VCS for short, is an international organization designed to train and dispatch chocogirls and chocoguys to stables across Vana'diel.${prompt}
They provide courses on practical chocobo riding and the proper ways to care for a chocobo, as well as working to improve the treatment of chocobos from here to Aht Urhgan.${prompt}
Anyone can join as long as they love chocobos. The VCS will help you with anything you need.${prompt}
Chicks hatch from eggs, grow into young chocobos, and finally mature.${prompt}
They grow much faster than people do. Usually it takes about 1 month (Earth time) before you can ride your chocobo.${prompt}
The chocobo's traits are determined by the way in which you care for your animal. Without proper planning, you won't be able to raise the type of chocobo that you want.${prompt}
But don't worry, because you have us to help! We're all in this together!${prompt}
Ask about which attribute?
${selection-lines}
Strength.
Endurance.
Discernment.
Receptivity.
Energy.
Affection.
Satisfaction.
Nothing.${prompt}

“Strength” is a term used to describe the chocobo's leg power. The more strength a chocobo has, the faster it will be able to run. Rental chocobos have been raised with an emphasis on this attribute.${prompt}
Both strength and endurance are collectively referred to as “Physical attributes.”${prompt}
“Endurance” is a term used to describe the chocobo's stamina. If your chocobo has high endurance, you will be able to ride it for a long period of time.${prompt}
Both strength and endurance are collectively referred to as “Physical attributes.”${prompt}
“Discernment” is a must for anyone who wants their chocobo to learn new abilities. You may want to consider raising this attribute if you are interested in digging for treasure.${prompt}
Both discernment and receptivity are collectively referred to as “Mental attributes.”${prompt}

“Receptivity” is a term used to describe the chocobo's sensitivity when dealing with others. You can foster receptivity in your chocobo by giving it lots of opportunities to communicate with other chocobos.${prompt}
Both discernment and receptivity are collectively referred to as “Mental attributes.”${prompt}

“Energy” is a term used to describe the amount of power the chocobo needs to stay active for the day. If your chocobo has a lot of energy, care plans are more likely to be successful and you can provide more direct care for your chocobo.${prompt}
You can restore your chocobo's energy by feeding it, so remember not to skip out on feeding time after a demanding schedule!${prompt}
“Affection” is the most important attribute of all. Your care schedule will fall flat if you don't show your chocobo proper affection!${prompt}
You can raise your chocobo's affection by feeding it greens and caring for it on a regular basis.${prompt}
If you really want to raise your chocobo's affection quickly, you can give it ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}, but I can't recommend doing so unless absolutely necessary.${prompt}
“Satisfaction” is a term used to describe how full or hungry your chocobo is. If your chocobo is full, it will gain a lot of energy before the next day.${prompt}
However, when the chocobo is very hungry, its energy will hardly recover at all and its affection will rapidly decrease.${prompt}
What would you like to ask about?
${selection-lines}
What is a care schedule?
Basic care.
Resting.
Taking a walk.
Listening to music.
Exercising alone.
Exercising in a group.
Interacting with children.
Interacting with chocobos.
Carrying packages.
Exhibiting to the public.
Delivering messages.
Digging for treasure.
Acting in a play.
Nothing.${prompt}
A care schedule is a series of plans that you set up for your chocobo so that we can take care of it while you are away.${prompt}
How you want us to care for your chocobo each day is completely up to you.${prompt}
You can register up to four plans at once, each for up to 7 days (Earth time).${prompt}
When you come to check on your chocobo, we will give you a report on the results. You should listen closely to the report and use it as reference when deciding on a new schedule.${prompt}
With the basic care plan, we will provide the minimum level of care for your chocobo. This plan is the most stable, and your chocobo will probably not experience any sudden changes.${prompt}
The basic care plan is good for those who don't want their chocobo's traits to change much or are still unsure of what kind of schedule to choose.${prompt}
You can select the basic care plan the moment you start raising your chocobo.${prompt}
The rest plan's name speaks for itself. We will give your chocobo a rest in order to restore its energy and cure any status abnormalities.${prompt}
However, your chocobo will not be able to eat any food you give it during the plan, because it will be in a deep sleep.${prompt}

We can take your chocobo for a walk in town to improve its physical attributes of strength and endurance. However, it will have a negative effect on its mental attributes of discernment and receptivity.${prompt}
Listening to music will improve your chocobo's mental attributes of discernment and receptivity. However, it will have a negative effect on its physical attributes of strength and endurance.${prompt}
Exercising alone will significantly improve your chocobo's strength. On the other hand, its mental attributes will markedly decrease.${prompt}
If the chocobo is strong, this plan is quite effective, but if the chocobo is weak, then you shouldn't push it too hard.${prompt}
Exercising with chocobos will build your animal's endurance. On the other hand, its mental attributes will decrease.${prompt}
If the chocobo has high endurance, this plan is quite effective, but if the chocobo's endurance is low, then you shouldn't push it too hard.${prompt}
Interacting with children helps your chocobo become a more discerning creature by interacting with people.${prompt}
However, this plan will have a negative effect on the chocobo's physical attributes, as no strenuous exercise is involved.${prompt}
If the chocobo has good discernment, this plan is quite effective, but if the chocobo does not have good discernment, then you shouldn't push it too hard.${prompt}
Interacting with other chocobos in the field will improve the chocobo's receptivity by fostering its communication skills.${prompt}
But because the focus is on communication and not exercise, this plan will have a negative effect on the chocobo's physical attributes.${prompt}
If the chocobo has good receptivity, this plan is quite effective, but if the chocobo does not have good receptivity, then you shouldn't push it too hard.${prompt}
You can choose to have your chocobo help deliver packages. Not only will this improve its physical attributes, but you will even receive payment for your services!${prompt}
The downside is that your chocobo's mental attributes, energy, and affection will decrease. You must care well for your chocobo, or you might find yourself getting cold treatment.${prompt}

You can choose to exhibit your chocobo to the public, which will allow anyone visiting the chocobo stables to take a look at your animal. Being the center of attention will help improve your chocobo's mental attributes.${prompt}
The downside is that your chocobo's physical attributes, energy, and affection will decrease. You must care well for your chocobo afterwards. Also, you will receive payment for this service.${prompt}
You can choose to have your chocobo deliver official messages for the nation. Not only will this improve its strength, but you will even receive payment for your services!${prompt}
However, this plan consumes quite a bit of your chocobo's energy, so you should feed it well to make up for it.${prompt}
You can have your chocobo help out VCS finances by digging for treasure. This will also improve the chocobo's discernment.${prompt}
The VCS will sell the item and use the money for the organization's benefit, but will provide you with payment for your services.${prompt}
However, this plan consumes quite a bit of your chocobo's energy, so you should feed it well to make up for it.${prompt}
You can choose to have your chocobo act as an extra in a play to improve its receptivity.${prompt}
You will receive payment in accordance with the chocobo's performance. However, this plan consumes quite a bit of your chocobo's energy, so you should feed it well to make up for it.${prompt}
What would you like to ask about?
${selection-lines}
A general explanation.
Watching over your chocobo.
Telling a story.
Scolding.
Competing.
Taking a walk.
Nothing.${prompt}
In addition to setting the chocobo's schedule, you can also care directly for your chocobo whenever you like.${prompt}
Caring for your chocobo will increase its affection for you.${prompt}
On the other hand, a chocobo that receives too much care will lose energy more rapidly when engaging in activities. If you do nothing but care for your chocobo, it will become fatigued.${prompt}
However, not caring enough for your chocobo will have a negative effect on your relationship, so it is important to find a balance.${prompt}
You can watch over your chocobo whenever you like.${prompt}
Your fond gaze can communicate even more than a touch and will not have a very tiring effect on the animal.${prompt}
You can tell the chocobo a story you know. This will foster the animal's sensibilities.${prompt}
I've heard that by listening to the story, the chocobo might even realize it has powers it never noticed before. (I've never seen it happen before, though...)${prompt}
Sometimes your chocobo might start acting spoiled or refuse to do anything but sleep. In such times, you will need to firmly scold it.${prompt}
This will shame the animal and have an effect on its receptivity.${prompt}
Competing against other chocobos will cultivate your animal's ambitious spirit and is highly effective for bored chocobos.${prompt}
You can take your chocobo out for a walk in the field. You will be able to choose more destinations as your chocobo grows.${prompt}
I like to take the chocobo out often, too, but I'm sure it prefers going out with you.${prompt}
Leaving the stables every once in a while allows your chocobo to experience new sights and sounds. Maybe you'll even discover something new together!${prompt}
What would you like to know about?
${selection-lines}
Why feeding is important.
Vegetables.
Wildgrasses.
Carrots.
Worms.
Medicines.
Pastes.
Nothing.${prompt}
Chocobos digest feed quickly, so they are often hungry.${prompt}
However, they also restore energy at a rapid pace. If you do not feed your chocobo properly, it will be unable to restore enough energy.${prompt}
The chocobo stables will provide your chocobo with the minimum amount of feed required for the animal to survive, but you need to provide more in order to ensure its healthy growth.${prompt}
At the same time, feeding your chocobo too much can result in a stomachache. Remember to strike a balance with both the variety and quantity of feed you give to your animal!${prompt}
Some types of feed have special effects, so it is important not to neglect your chocobo's diet if you want to raise a good chocobo.${prompt}
There are different methods of acquiring these special types of feed, so be on the lookout for them!${prompt}
Just ${color: 5}trade${color: 1} the feed to an advanced chocobo trainer, and they will give it to your chocobo.${prompt}
This is the standard variety of chocobo feed, among which ${item-plural: 0[2]} are most popular.${prompt}
Chocobos also seem to enjoy ${item-plural: 0[2]} and ${item-plural: 1[2]}.${prompt}
These greens are the most effective in satisfying a chocobo's hunger. Chocobos also enjoy the taste, which raises affection for their owner.${prompt}
Wildgrasses are a type of medicinal herb. They do not taste very good, but are highly effective at curing status abnormalities.${prompt}
${lettercase: 1}${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}, for example, works well on wounds. So although they look similar to ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]}, the effects are different.${prompt}

In addition, ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]} is effective for illness, and ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]} for a stomachache. It's a good idea to remember which herb to use in each situation.${prompt}
Carrots are high in nutrition, and will have an effect on the chocobo's strength and discernment.${prompt}

${lettercase: 1}${item-plural: 0[2]}, for example, affect the chocobo's physical attributes, and ${item-plural: 1[2]} are good for its mental attributes. ${lettercase: 1}${item-plural: 2[2]} are in a category of their own.${prompt}
Remember, though, that the results are very slight, and keeping a good care schedule is a far more efficient way to alter your chocobo's attributes.${prompt}
Using worms as feed can have a variety of effects. They might look disgusting, but their effectiveness is not to be ignored!${prompt}
For example, ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]} will dramatically increase your chocobo's affection, and ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]} will restore its energy.${prompt}
But watch out for the side effects... Give the chocobo a worm at the wrong time, and all your effort could come to nothing...${prompt}
The most curious of all the worms is the ${item-singular: 0[2]}. At first it may not seem to have any effect, but looks are deceiving...${prompt}
Medicines can cure a chocobo in the blink of an eye.${prompt}
${lettercase: 1}${article} ${item-article: 0[2]} will restore your chocobo's energy in full, making it easier to care for and ensuring that the care schedule goes smoothly.${prompt}

${lettercase: 1}${item-plural: 0[2]} are effective for most status abnormalities, restoring instant health to your chocobo. Of course, you still need to continue caring for your chocobo so it can fully recover.${prompt}
A potion can also help fill a chocobo's stomach, so they can be useful when you are short on feed.${prompt}
Feed can be ground into paste for chicks to eat.${prompt}
You can make paste yourself with some cooking skill. If you don't have enough cooking skill yourself, then you might want to ask a friend to make some for you.${prompt}
Chicks can also eat regular feed, though.${prompt}

${selection-lines}

Nothing.${prompt}
Your chocobo may learn useful abilities during the course of its life at the stables.${prompt}
For example, Auto-Regen will increase the rate at which your chocobo restores energy. Such an ability is sure to come in handy in a variety of situations.${prompt}
Your chocobo learns abilities by listening to your words, so if you know of any story that you think might interest the animal, you should tell it often.${prompt}
But remember, your chocobo can't learn all of the abilities there are. It can only learn two...or at least, that's what I read.${prompt}
The chocobo's temperament is determined when it is just a chick. Its temperament and attributes are somehow related, but I'm not really sure how.${prompt}
Chocobos generally like sunny days, but they could grow to like other kinds of weather depending on how they are raised.${prompt}
Chocobos pay attention to the air outside when they go on walks, and grow to prefer that type of weather because of the memories.${prompt}

Make the animal's schedule around its preferred weather days, and plans are more likely to succeed. However, if the chocobo has a favored type of weather, it also dislikes certain conditions, creating a weak point to watch for.${prompt}
You can choose to retire your chocobo at any time after it has fully matured.${prompt}
After retirement, the VCS will take up caring for the chocobo where you left off, so you need not worry about its welfare.${prompt}
When your chocobo retires, you will receive ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}. Be sure not to lose it.${prompt}
You can use the ${item-singular: 0[2]} to register your chocobo to call in the field or for matchmaking purposes after retirement. All you need to do is trade it to a VCS member.${prompt}
The empty stall created after your animal retires can be used for raising other chocobos, so if you happen to come across another egg, you can bring it here to start all over again!${prompt}
When your chocobo is mature enough, you can breed it with another chocobo. If the chocobo lays an egg, the chick will inherit the traits of its parents.${prompt}

You will need ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]} and ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]} if you want to breed your chocobo. Apparently, you also need some kind of ticket that they sell at the stables in Upper Jeuno.${prompt}
You can ask one of the VCS members to issue you a chococard, or if your chocobo is already retired, just trade them ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}.${prompt}
I don't really know that much about it, but you should probably try matching your chocobo up with several different animals and seeing what the results are.${prompt}
When your chocobo is mature enough, you can call it in the field using ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}.${prompt}
You need to let a member of the VCS know which chocobo you want to respond to your call, because they must choose a saddle that fits your chocobo's attributes.${prompt}
That also means that when your chocobo's attributes change or it learns a new ability, you should probably let the VCS member know, too.${prompt}
When you want to register a retired chocobo to respond to your call in the field, trade ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]} to a VCS member.${prompt}
Also, the ${item-singular: 0[2]}'s power will grow weak after you've used it several times.${prompt}
If this happens, just trade it to a VCS member and they will give you a new one for a fee.${prompt}

Welcome to the Chocobo Racing Association's (CRA) ${choice: 0}[San d'Oria/Bastok/Windurst] branch.
This service desk is here to accommodate our beginning and intermediate racers.${prompt}
I am sorry, but there are no races scheduled at the moment.${prompt}
Participation in our organization's races requires that you either possess ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]} or currently have your own full-grown chocobo.${prompt}
How about you, ${choice-player-gender}[sir/ma'am]?${prompt}

If possible, we would like you to join us, and help show those trainers in ${choice: 0}[Bastok and Windurst/San d'Oria and Windurst/San d'Oria and Bastok] which racing team is truly the best in Vana'diel.${prompt}

${selection-lines}

${selection-lines}

Why not!?
Our original plan was to establish locations across Vana'diel where people could test their birds' skills.${prompt}
We felt that this would help us maintain breeder motivation, which in turn would ensure healthier, happier chocobos. A “win-win situation,” as we like to call it in the business.${prompt}
However, as rumors of these new facilities began to leak out into the world, people began speculating about the possibility of officially sanctioned chocobo races...${prompt}
The VCS could not ignore the voice of the masses, and it was not long before a meeting was held, a vote was taken, and the CRA was formed.${prompt}
And that's why I'm here, trying to enlist you and other top breeders into our noble ranks.${prompt}
Oh, and for our more seasoned veterans who feel there are no challenges left for them here at the track, the CRA has finished preparing a new race. And rumor has that it's a doozie!${prompt}
First of all, your chocobo must be fully grown. It doesn't matter if you are still tending to it, or if it has been sent to pasture, as long as it is large enough to ride.${prompt}
Next, you must bring me either ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]} or ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]}. This is all I will require. There are no hidden fees.${prompt}
As your chocobo develops, be sure to re-register it. This will ensure that your steed is provided with the equipment that most suits its current condition.${prompt}
Finally, you may only register one chocobo at a time, but are free to register a new bird whenever you wish. You need only speak with me to make any necessary changes.${prompt}
Once you have registered your chocobo and entered it in a competition, the CRA will proceed in assigning it a licensed jockey.${prompt}
Before each race you will be given the opportunity to give the jockey specific orders on his or her riding style.${prompt}
In addition to these orders, you can also provide the jockey with items to use while riding, as well as equipment to improve your chocobo's performance.${prompt}

Before a race, you can also check the strengths and weaknesses of the other participating chocobos. It is recommended that you use this data when deciding on what orders to give, or which items to equip.${prompt}
Depending on your chocobo's performance in select CRA-sanctioned races, you may or may not receive a prize consisting of VCS-mint ${color: 5}chocobucks${color: 1}.${prompt}
Chocobucks can be used to purchase items, as well as upgrade your mount. Chocobucks are also required to participate in official races.${prompt}
Currently, players can earn up to, but no more than, 1000 chocobucks. However, this may change without notice.${prompt}
There are two main types of races.${prompt}
The first type is called an ${color: 5}official race${color: 1}. To participate in one of these, you will require chocobucks.${prompt}
Placing in an official race will earn you gil. The more races you complete, the more respected you will become in the breeder community.${prompt}
You may also take part in an official race as often as needed to complete the specified objectives.${prompt}

However, after some of the more grueling races, you may be required to wait before entering the next. This is to give your chocobo, as well as the others, an opportunity to rest before running again.${prompt}
The second type of race is called a ${color: 5}free run${color: 1}. Unlike the official races, these can be run at any time, regardless of the results of a previous match.${prompt}

You must pay a fee in gil to participate in free runs, but you will have the opportunity to earn chocobucks depending on your chocobo's performance. You can join as many free runs as you wish in a single day (Earth time), but extra fees may be required for each additional race. (Stable hands have to make a living, too!)${prompt}
The CRA is split up into three racing teams representing Bastok, Windurst, and San d'Oria.${prompt}
Each team has its own skilled jockeys, and offers unique services that cannot be obtained at the other two.${prompt}
Breeders are allowed to register with any team they like, and may change their affiliation at any time.${prompt}
In the event that you wish to leave a racing team, all official race results, as well as earned chocobucks, will be saved.${prompt}
You never have to worry that your past accomplishments may be deleted and lost forever. You only need rejoin the team to restore all your old data.${prompt}
Anyway, there is no harm in visiting all three racing teams to find which one suits you best (though I know you'll choose this one).${prompt}
Ah, it says here that you are a member of the ${choice: 0}[San d'Oria/Bastok/Windurst] racing team.${prompt}

This racetrack is equipped with portals to transport our patrons to any of the three nations, as well as Jeuno and Al Zahbi.${prompt}

As you can see, we are regularly visited by a multitude of race fans, breeders, and jockeys from every realm imaginable. We have therefore relegated each portal to a single destination in an attempt to avoid congestion.${prompt}
For the same reasons, we ask that visitors refrain from setting up bazaars while here. Violators of this rule will be severely punished.

A race chocobo's owner or jockey may join one of the three racing teams by registering at the appropriate VCS branch.${prompt}
Each nation's Team Victory Points are the sum total of all of its members' Solo Victory Points. The Team Victory Point totals are then used to determine the overall weekly standings.${prompt}
In order to race your chocobo here, we ask that you please affiliate yourself first with one of the three teams.${prompt}
For details, please check with your local CRA racing center.${prompt}
The races held here are almost identical to the official and private races held at the other racetracks.${prompt}
What distinguishes our races is the fact that victories here qualify you to collect larger cash purses, as well as Victory Points.${prompt}
Eligibility to participate in the higher-level races will require a certain number of Solo Victory Points.${prompt}
Depending on a team's weekly standings, its members may suffer certain eligibility restrictions. At the same time, they may also be privy to certain benefits.${prompt}
The teams in second and third place will have the advantage of being allowed more entry positions in any given race, while those of the leading team are restricted.${prompt}
The leading team will, however, be granted the privilege of selecting higher-quality saddles for their race chocobos.${prompt}
The CRA reserves the right to impose a handicap system when it is determined that the gap in skill between chocobos is simply too great to make for a fair race.${prompt}
In such an event, the “less endowed” of the chocobos will be granted certain enhancing effects, such as Haste or Refresh.${prompt}
Whether handicaps will be enforced or not will be determined after signups are complete. Make sure to keep an eye on your chocobo's settings.${prompt}
Each race title will include a code, such as C4. This code is the “race grade.”${prompt}
For example, a “C4 Chocobo Race” would indicate a typical grade 4 race.${prompt}
We have four race grades, ranging from C4 to C1. The lower the number, the higher the grade. This, of course, means larger entry fees, but also more prize money.${prompt}

No matter which race you enter, upon completion you will be prevented from joining any other races for a period of 20 hours (Earth time). Higher-grade races carry larger purses, so most racers like to use their opportunities to go after those.${prompt}
Solo Victory Points will be awarded to you every race, depending on how well you finish.${prompt}
As your Solo Victory Points accumulate, your chocobo will be able to gain entry to high-grade races.${prompt}
Should a racer return to the circuit after an absence of four weeks or more, the CRA will be forced to deduct a number of Solo Victory Points.${prompt}

Only on the rarest of occasions will such penalties be imposed. However, there are some races in which you will be unable to participate if you do not have a certain amount of Solo Victory Points in your possession.${prompt}
Also, obtaining Solo Victory Points will also grant your nation Team Victory Points.${prompt}
The three teams are in constant competition with one another, and a weekly ranking system is in place based on Team Victory Point totals.${prompt}
As a team climbs up in rank, certain benefits will follow. You may see new items available for purchase with chocobucks, preferential treatment at the races, and so on.${prompt}
Keep in mind that should you change your team affiliation, you will be forced to forfeit any accumulated Solo Victory Points.${prompt}
We have a total of four races that run in succession.${prompt}
Each race has its own dedicated signup window. Here there will be four attendants ready to serve all your racing needs.${prompt}
Even if the race registration at one window closes, registration for the next race will begin immediately at the neighboring window.${prompt}
Races will be held one after the other, so you'll have plenty of chances to watch and bet. Sit back, relax, and enjoy!${prompt}

There are a few facts that you should know before running in a race.${prompt}
First of all, you absolutely must be affiliated with one of the three official racing teams. These, as you may already know, are San d'Oria, Bastok, and Windurst.${prompt}
Secondly, it is required that your bird be registered as a “race chocobo,” for obvious reasons. No race chocobo, no race.${prompt}
Thirdly, you will be responsible for providing your own items to be used during the race. The CRA leaves this to the racer's discretion...${prompt}
All of these services can be provided at any racing center, but to facilitate the registration process it is recommended that you conduct all such affairs at the appropriate branch.${prompt}
A racing fee is necessary to gain entry into a chocobo race. The racing center will inform you of the cost, so please be sure to pay when signing up for a race.${prompt}
Also, when signing up to race, you will be able to choose a saddle, as well as the lane in which your chocobo will race.${prompt}

There are multifarious saddles at the rider's disposal, each of which will affect your chocobo's conditioning. In addition, the types of saddles available will change depending on your team's current ranking.${prompt}
There are a total of eight lanes, but general conditions for all of them are the same. Feel free to race in the lane of your choice.${prompt}
Setting these options will complete the signup process. You will then be given ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}, which you will need to exchange later to collect any winnings.${prompt}

In the event that you should lose or misplace your ${item-singular: 0[2]}, you will be unable to collect any prize money, chocobucks, or Victory Points that you may be entitled to. I cannot stress enough how important it is to hold on to it.${prompt}
The races can be viewed from our grandstand area. Take a seat and cheer on your bird!${prompt}
You will be eligible for prize money if your chocobo places either first, second, or third.${prompt}
To collect, simply hand in the ${item-singular: 0[2]} you received during race signup at any signup center.${prompt}
The amount of gil, chocobucks, and Victory Points you qualify to receive will be based upon your bird's placement.${prompt}
You will lose the right to collect your winnings from a race exactly one week after that race has ended.${prompt}
After participating in a race, your chocobo will be unable to join any other races for a period of 20 hours (Earth time).${prompt}
This pertains only to races held here, and will not affect your eligibility for races held at any other racetracks.${prompt}
We have implemented these restrictions here as to allow the greatest number of participants' entry into our races. Your patience and understanding are appreciated.${prompt}
What would you like to ask?
${selection-lines}
What is chocobetting?
How do I bet?
What are odds?
When do I bet?
How do I collect winnings?
Nothing.${prompt}
Chocobetting is a form of entertainment where bettors attempt to pick the two birds that will finish first and second in a race.${prompt}
To make it a bit more interesting, the bettor can then wager on their picks in increments of 100 gil.${prompt}
Should lady luck smile upon you and your picks hit, you can win prize money, the amount of which is determined by the odds for that race.${prompt}
For example, let's say that you were to bet ten quills (1000 gil) on Entries No. 5 and No. 7.${prompt}

And let's say that the toteboard showed the odds for the race at 110 gil. If your picks were to finish as the top two birds, you would be eligible to collect 1100 gil in winnings, for a total profit of 100 gil.${prompt}
Of course, it goes without saying that should your picks not have the fortune of finishing in the top two places, you will receive absolutely no gil.${prompt}
The gambler's fallacy is our mantra here at the racetrack! Remember, you are special! Let it ride!${prompt}
To place a chocobet, you must obtain ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]} from the chocobet center. ${prompt}
For any single ${item-singular: 0[2]}, a bettor may purchase up to 999 quills. Each quill costs 100 gil.${prompt}
We highly recommend that you obtain information on the chocobos you will be betting on before purchasing your ticket. It is always good to know where your money is going.${prompt}
Odds determine how much gil you will receive in winnings per quill on your chocobet ticket.${prompt}

Winnings are calculated by taking the total monetary sum of all bets for any given pairing. For example, should ten bettors each place the same 100-quill (10,000 gil) chocobet, the total used to determine the winnings would be 100,000 gil.${prompt}
It goes without saying that not all bettors will be winners. The money from losing bets is used to pay off the winners.${prompt}

What this means is that if you place a bet on an unseemly chocobo pairing, or pick two birds without much money riding on them, and are fortunate enough to win, you can make quite a tidy sum.${prompt}

Toteboards display the odds at both the chocobet center as well as the grandstand. Toteboards have eight columns with the number on top of each column representing one chocobo, and the number to the left of each column representing another. If your bet is for chocobos No. 2 and No. 5, check the #2 column to see how much a 2-5 bet will pay per quill.${prompt}
The odds are constantly changing right up until the race begins. If the number of bets on a popular chocobo pairing keeps increasing, then consequently the odds will go down.${prompt}
Even if you place a large bet early on, the odds may still change as time passes. So take your time and consider carefully.${prompt}
Chocobets can be placed as soon as the signup period for a race has ended. The betting window will close several minutes before the race begins.${prompt}
Make sure to get your bet in on time. Even if you are in the middle of placing a bet, it will be cancelled if you exceed the allowed time window by even a single second.${prompt}
Once the race is finished, you can exchange your ${item-singular: 0[2]} at any chocobet center to collect your winnings.${prompt}
Without ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]} you will be unable to collect your winnings, so make sure not to lose it.${prompt}
${lettercase: 1}${article} ${item-article: 0[2]} is valid for up to one week (Earth time) after completion of the race for which it was purchased.${prompt}
Should one week pass, we will be unable to accept the ticket, so it is always best to cash out as soon as possible.${prompt}

With the establishment of the Chocobo Circuit and the introduction of chocobo races, the hidden talents of a number of chocobos across Vana'diel finally had a venue in which to come to fruition.${prompt}
As the next step, the CRA recognized these rare and valuable talents, and developed a new, special kind of race to showcase them even more than before!${prompt}
“The Monster Races”!${prompt}
Without the interference of jockeys, breeders can now pit their chocobos head-to-head against a number of monster species in brutal, raw, no-holds-barred racing! ${prompt}
Even some of the CRA's very own best and brightest chocobos will be entering into these races geared specifically to our veteran clientele.
What more thrilling way to spend a day at the races than to see Vana'diel's most elite chocobos competing against its most fiendish monsters!?${prompt}
First of all, your chocobo must be fully grown. It doesn't matter if you are still tending to it, or if it has been sent to pasture, as long as it is large enough to ride.${prompt}
Next, you must bring me either ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]} or ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]}. This is all I will require. There are no hidden fees.${prompt}
As your chocobo develops, be sure to re-register it. This will ensure that your steed is provided with the equipment that most suits its current condition.${prompt}
Finally, you may only register one chocobo at a time, but are free to register a new bird whenever you wish. You need only speak with me to make any necessary changes.${prompt}

Since these races are geared towards our more veteran racers and will not make use of jockeys, all in-race conduct is based solely on the chocobos themselves. The CRA wants these races to be as pure as possible!${prompt}
The same philosophy applies to the usage of items as well. Simply preset the items you wish for your chocobo to have at its disposal.
It will use them as it sees fit based on real-time assessment of racing conditions.${prompt}
Many breeders are distressed by these rules, but we assure you there is no need for concern.

If your chocobo has progressed far enough in the Chocobo Circuit to even be participating in the Monster Races, it is a given that it has enough know-how to use its items wisely. Have faith in your bird.${prompt}
Also, as with other races in the past, you will be able to check on the strengths and weaknesses of your opponents at this service area.
Many breeders like to use this information for developing their race strategies, and we encourage you to do the same.${prompt}
Depending on your chocobo's performance in select CRA-sanctioned races, you may or may not receive a prize consisting of VCS-mint ${color: 5}chocobucks${color: 1}.${prompt}
Chocobucks can be used to purchase items, as well as upgrade your mount. Chocobucks are also required to participate in official races.${prompt}
Currently, players can earn up to, but no more than, 1000 chocobucks. However, this may change without notice.${prompt}
There are two main types of races.${prompt}
The first type is called an ${color: 5}official race${color: 1}. To participate in one of these, you will require chocobucks.${prompt}
Placing in an official race will earn you gil. The more races you complete, the more respected you will become in the breeder community.${prompt}
You may also take part in an official race as often as needed to complete the specified objectives.${prompt}

However, after some of the more grueling races, you may be required to wait before entering the next. This is to give your chocobo, as well as the others, an opportunity to rest before running again.${prompt}

The second type of race is called a ${color: 5}free run${color: 1}. Unlike the official races, these can be run at any time, regardless of the results of a previous match. In addition, you will have the opportunity to earn chocobucks depending on your chocobo's performance.${prompt}
You are not able to sign up for free runs at this location. To do so, please visit the appropriate service area for beginning and intermediate racers.
Thank you for your understanding.${prompt}
The CRA is split up into three racing teams representing Bastok, Windurst, and San d'Oria.${prompt}
Each team has its own skilled jockeys, and offers unique services that cannot be obtained at the other two.${prompt}
Breeders are allowed to register with any team they like, and may change their affiliation at any time.${prompt}
In the event that you wish to leave a racing team, all official race results, as well as earned chocobucks, will be saved.${prompt}
You never have to worry that your past accomplishments may be deleted and lost forever. You only need rejoin the team to restore all your old data.${prompt}
Anyway, there is no harm in visiting all three racing teams to find which one suits you best (though I know you'll choose this one).${prompt}
Your opponents in the official monster races will be any of a host of beasts reared and trained by racing aficionado and announcer extraordinaire, Markovich.${prompt}
We ensure all participating breeders that these monsters are in no way enhanced or engineered for racing excellence.
The CRA has been adamant about maintaining race participants to as close to their natural state of being as possible.${prompt}
Though each variety of monster does in fact possess characteristic abilities and traits.
And they have undergone extensive training to optimize their use of these in races.${prompt}
As with the chocobos, however, the monsters will be absent jockeys of any kind.
It is possible, and expected, that they will often unleash their wild, animalistic instincts on the racetrack.
Consider yourself warned.${prompt}
In the spirit of drawing crowds, the CRA has also elected to place some of their finest birds on the racing roster as well.
Breeders can also expect to see other superior-class chocobos taking part.
It's going to take a lot more than just speed and endurance to win these races!${prompt}
Finally, in the absence of jockeys, finish-line sensors will be employed.
These devices will be attached to the contestants' ankles, or in the absence of ankles, some other such appropriate place.${prompt}

When purchasing a chocobet ticket, you will be asked to place a quinella bet. This means that you will choose the two chocobos that you think will place first and second. If you are lucky enough to win, you may then exchange the ticket and collect your winnings.${prompt}
In our current chocobet system, as long as your two picks finish in the top two, the order doesn't matter.${prompt}
The size of a chocobet ticket is measured in quills. One quill costs 100 gil, and a single ticket can contain up to 999 quills. Try it once, and you'll get hooked for sure!${prompt}
You can stand to make quite a profit if you buy a chocobet ticket and it hits!${prompt}
The fewer the bettors who have selected the same chocobos as you, the greater your winnings will be! In the industry, we call those the “odds.”${prompt}
You can always check the current odds when you place a chocobet. However, the odds are always apt to change right up until the chocobet window closes for that race. So be careful!${prompt}
To collect your winnings, simply bring your chocobet ticket back to any of us here at the betting center.${prompt}
However, you should know that a winning chocobet ticket is only valid for one week following completion of the race. After that, it will expire, so be sure to cash it in before then!${prompt}

With me today is a man who needs absolutely no introduction, Markovich, and our favorite...${prompt}
Isn't the adorable Sakura with us today?${prompt}
I'm afraid Sakura's been rather busy lately and won't be able to join us here at these races. I'll do my best to make up for her absence.${prompt}
Is that so...?
Things just won't be the same without her lovably abrasive, tongue-in-cheek comments...${prompt}
Hmph! Enough of that crying into your microphone.
You of all people should know that the show must go on!${prompt}
Besides, today we have a very special race in store for our viewers. My very own “baby” will be taking the field!${prompt}
Why, I was so looking forward to today's race, I couldn't catch a single wink of sleep last night!${prompt}
But of course! I had forgotten all about it!
Ladies and gentlemen, have we got a special treat for you!
Today's race will see a chocobo and a monster go head-to-head!${prompt}
But that's not where it ends!
There will be not a single jockey to adulterate this epic battle of bird versus beast! How do you like the sound of that, folks?${prompt}
A bold experiment in racing, if I do say so myself.
Markovich, how do you foresee the competitors reacting to each other's presence in this most unusual of settings?${prompt}
It is my understanding that an especially intelligent chocobo was chosen to partake in this race, so there shouldn't be any worry about it being spooked.${prompt}
Moreover, my little fluffykins is as well-bred and well-behaved as your average head of state!
But...${prompt}
But...?${prompt}
I can't say anything for certain heading into this race. After all, nothing like this has ever been attempted in the history of chocobo racing.${prompt}
I see...
Could that perhaps be the reason why this first-ever experiment has been limited to a one-on-one affair?${prompt}
You're certainly on the ball today, Goccilo.
Even if the chances are slim, we wouldn't want anything to go awry now, would we?${prompt}
But enough talking, I say.
It's time to give the viewers what they've come here to see!${prompt}
Oh, yes, right...
Ladies and gentlemen, sorry for the delay!
It is my pleasure to introduce the two plucky participants in this history-making race!${prompt}
In the chocobo corner, we have ${chocobo-name: 0[2]}, undisputed champion of the official races, and considered by many to be one of the greatest birds ever to grace the Chocobo Circuit.${prompt}
Oooh... So this is the much hyped-about chocobo?
I wonder if it'll be able to stand up to my Pacey.${prompt}
${chocobo-name: 0[2]}'s formidable opponent will be Phantom Pacer! Don't let the lamblike good looks fool you, folks. This one truly lives up to the expression, “a wolf in sheep's clothing”!${prompt}

I'll have you know that Pacey's appearance isn't just for show. I've survived many a cold winter snuggling up to her fluffy coat. Much better for my aching joints than a crackling fire, I tell you!${prompt}
I'm absolutely breathless! That was as hotly contested a race as we have seen in recent years! Any thoughts, Markovich?${prompt}
Hrm. This race has proven beyond doubt that “monsters” like my Pacey can race alongside chocobos without any problems whatsoever.${prompt}
Indeed! I for one am certainly looking forward to seeing more such races!${prompt}
With me today is our regular avian advocate turned adversary, Markovich!${prompt}
Whoopee!
Bring them on, I say!${prompt}
Erm...yes...
Now, let's take a look at the courageous contenders in today's race.${prompt}
Oooh, so this is the chocobo that's been making headlines. I wonder if it'll be a match for my babies.${prompt}
Next, we have the perennial woodenspooner, Keyaki!
Despite its dismal track record, its never-say-die attitude has earned the admiration of fans and competitors alike.${prompt}
Truly a bird on a mission, Goccilo.
I just hope I'll live long enough to see its efforts pay off.${prompt}
And with four monsters completing the lineup, I think we can brace ourselves for another encounter of epic proportion!${prompt}
My, oh my...!
I never imagined commentating would be so enjoyable without Sakura around to--${prompt}
A-ahem!
I...I mean, um, yes, I believe the race lived up to all expectations. No racing enthusiast could possibly go home disappointed after such an inspirational display.${prompt}
All competitors raced gallantly and are deserving of praise, but none more so than the victor...who just happens to be one of my babies!
Well done, my pretty! Well done!${prompt}
It's unfortunate, though, that race conditions hindered the performance of some of the more promising contenders...
<Sniffle>${prompt}
Next in the lineup is Sakura.${wait-36: 2}
...!? What on Vana'diel!?${prompt}
Hrmmm...
Well, they do say that imitation is the sincerest form of flattery.${prompt}
Uh, of course, that couldn't have been our Sakura. Though I must admit, for a moment there...I mean, who wouldn't have been shocked to see...${prompt}
What are you blabbering on about now? Pull yourself together, man!
There are countless race fans waiting to be entertained by our witty commentary!${prompt}
Um, yes... Please forgive me...${prompt}
And won't you look at the lineup!
This time we have a tiger...and even a raptor! Can you believe it, folks?
I'm sure glad to be up here and not down on the track alongside the likes of them! Is there no creature they won't bring in!?${prompt}
And with me today is our regular guest commentator...${prompt}
Huh?
Why isn't Markovich here?${prompt}
Ohohohohohoho!
You seem in a bind, Mister Goccilo.${prompt}
<Gulp>
You...you're that mage from Windurst...${prompt}
...Professor Shantotto!${prompt}
If you're in need of a replacement for Markovich,
as a racing connoisseur, I'd be glad to make the switch.${prompt}
Furthermore, in a stroke of sheer coincidence,
four custom-built Cardians are here in my presence.${prompt}
So if you care to hear out my little proposal,
these race-ready Cardians are also at your disposal.${prompt}
With Markovich and his racing monsters absent, looks like I have no other choice...
Will you really help us, Professor Shantotto?${prompt}
With which black-hearted biddy do you have me confused?
Enough with your doubting, there are competitors waiting to be introduced.${prompt}
First up, we have Jack of Trophies, who has been climbing the Cardian ranks at breakneck speed since its upgrade.${prompt}
Jack of Trophies' transfiguration was a sight to behold.
I just can't wait to see how its story will unfold.${prompt}
Next, I introduce to you, Queen of Trophies, who has been the mainstay of Windurst's Cardian force since its inception.${prompt}
Queen of Trophies knows not the meaning of the word “failure.”
Once set on a mission, from that course it will not veer.${prompt}

Then we have King of Trophies, whose state-of-the-art leg component is a testament to Windurst's achievements in magical engineering. This experimental Cardian could very well be the future of Cardian technology, folks.${prompt}
Even I dare not claim to know of what King of Trophies is capable.
If some mishap should occur, be so kind as to not hold me culpable.${prompt}
Next we have Ace of Trophies, whose racing prowess is vouched to be in a class of its own. Make no mistake, ladies and gentlemen--this Cardian is a championship contender!${prompt}
For Ace of Trophies, “championship contender” is an unfitting description.
Even “consecutive champion” would not be too high an expectation.${prompt}
Um...Professor Shantotto...
Shouldn't we be introducing other race participants as well...and not only your Cardians?${prompt}
Ohohohohoho!
Your impeccable attention to detail pleases me so.
But as we lack for time, on to the race, we must go!${prompt}
Even these race-bred chocobos shrivel before my Cardian entourage.
Compared to the automatons, they're as slow as a splintery river barge.${prompt}
Now, I think, we've all had a sufficient preview.
So let the race begin, without further ado!${prompt}
Ohohohohohoho!
Of this inevitable result, I was always assured--
that a Cardian would come away with victory secured!${prompt}
The home ground advantage was not in my Cardians' favor.
But with some minor adjustments, victory shall be mine to savor.${prompt}
H-hey!
What do you think you're trying to pull here!?${prompt}
My, my, what a pleasant surprise!
I'm relieved to see that you are well...and alive.${prompt}
How dare you “ohoho” your way into my hard-earned commentary seat!
This is a blatant act of...racejacking! You despicable...racejacker!${prompt}
Hush now, we mustn't resort to such hurtful vilification.
I merely wished to let you take that much-deserved vacation.${prompt}
And you, Goccilo!
What were you thinking, replacing me with the likes of her!? And don't you think that I don't notice how you slack off when Sakura isn't here!${prompt}
Ahem! W-well folks, that's it for another exciting edition of chocobo racing!
Until next time...!${prompt}
${name-player}, I knew you'd make it all the way here.${prompt}
What's with the baffled expression?
It's me, Sakura.${prompt}
You see, I'm actually a full-grown bird.
I've been hiding it all this time, using a transformation item to pose as a cuddly chocobo chick.${prompt}

I was separated from my mother at a very young age, and have been with Markovich ever since he found me as a stray chick. But all these years, I've never once given up on finding my real mother.${prompt}
I have only a few memories left of her--that she was an accomplished racing chocobo...${prompt}
And that she quit racing because she felt the circuit was no longer enough of a challenge.${prompt}

I thought that if I could get together a strong enough field of competitors, Mother would be enticed to return to the fray. That's why I'm here today--to seek the best racing chocobos to run in the upcoming Dream Race.${prompt}
Working in race commentary as a chick, and now running in this race... Everything has been for the purpose of being reunited with Mother. Not even Markovich knows what I've been doing.${prompt}
I intend to invite today's victor to participate in the Dream Race.${prompt}
I hope that'll be your chocobo, ${name-player}!${prompt}
And next, we have Sakura.${wait-36: 2}
But something seems to be different...
Ah, her coat is a different color from when she appeared in the Deadly Race.${prompt}
She must have obtained feather dye by trading chocobucks. She sure knows how to doll herself up!${prompt}
The next competitor is Scorching Needle, a cactuar whose explosive acceleration is second to none.${prompt}
I remember the time when it suddenly ran off on me. Boy, did it give me the runaround!
A friendly reminder, folks: Be sure to wear gloves when handling cactuar.${prompt}
And now, we come to Albinic Amami, a rabbit boasting jaw-dropping vertical jumping power and silken white fur that is irresistible to the touch.${prompt}
It trains by jumping back and forth over my head! Gets me rather dizzy after a while, though.${prompt}
And that completes the lineup, folks.
With such a colorful combination of creatures, I have a feeling this race won't soon be forgotten by the fans!${prompt}
You find ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}.${prompt}
Welcome to the Dream Race, ${name-player}.${prompt}
I've decided to participate in this race as my true self.${prompt}
I've always had an inferiority complex about being a different color from other chocobos.${prompt}
I wanted to be normal and fit in. That's why I've been dyeing my feathers all these years.${prompt}
But no more...

The synergy furnaces you see around town are provided as a public service by the Bastokan Institute of Synergy Research, to ensure that no synergist is ever far away from the tools of their trade.${prompt}
The synergist must provide his or her own ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}, as well as any materials to be used in the synergy process.
Provided those conditions are met, synergy furnaces may be used free of charge.${prompt}
Needless to say, only one party may operate any given furnace at once.${prompt}
Fortunately, there are multiple furnaces installed throughout town.
If the furnace before you is already in use, please seek out an unused one elsewhere, or wait patiently for your turn.${prompt}
You may think of synergy as an evolved form of synthesis.
It is a discipline full of heretofore unimagined possibilities, but one which demands consummate skill from its practitioners.${prompt}
Like synthesis, synergy involves combining materials according to a prescribed recipe to yield oft-spectacular results.
The rub is that each synergy recipe also dictates a certain elemental balance that must be achieved for the procedure to be successful.${prompt}
This balance is achieved through skillful infusion of combustible elemental crystals that we synergists call “fewell.”
To begin the synergy process, you'll have to feed the furnace with fewell and get those flames burning!${prompt}
As a general rule, the more complex the recipe, the more fewell it will require.
Take care to check your stock before you fire up the furnace, lest you find its flames guttering out at a crucial moment.${prompt}
With the belly of the furnace roaring up a storm, it's time to toss in your materials and start synergizing!

Keep a close eye on the balance of elements and deploy fewell as necessary. Approach the prescribed elemental balance, and your item will take form, allowing you to remove it from the furnace.${prompt}
The closer you are to the ideal elemental balance, the higher the quality of your finished product will be.
In synergy, it pays to be a perfectionist!${prompt}
But be forewarned: these furnaces can only sustain the elemental maelstrom swirling and storming inside them for so long.${prompt}
If the furnace's durability should fail, the synergy process will be interrupted, and you will be forced to start anew.${prompt}
Take heart, though, as any materials inside your ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} will remain intact.
You may retrieve them or attempt the synergy process again as you see fit.${prompt}
Any fewell consumed in the failed synergy attempt, on the other hand, will be permanently lost.${prompt}
Synergists must also be wary of debris buildup, an unavoidable side effect of the volatile elemental reactions that take place within the synergy furnace.${prompt}
Should too much debris be allowed to accumulate, the contents of the furnace will become unstable, potentially leading to unpleasant explosions and eruptions.
Such accidents pose considerable risk to the synergy attempt in progress, as well as the physical well-being of the synergist, so be sure to exercise due caution!${prompt}
You may be asking yourself, “Why, how in the name of Hildolf am I going to oversee all of these complicated procedures and variables by myself?”${prompt}
Here's the good news: you don't have to!
For you see, synergy furnaces are designed for use by multiple operators.${prompt}
The more complex the recipe, the greater level of skill and hands-on manipulation it will demand.
At such times, it would be in your best interest to seek out like-minded synergists and take on the challenge together.${prompt}
Finally, it would be remiss of me not to make mention of ${item-singular: 0[2]}, the curious substance whose properties are only now--with the emergence of synergy--becoming known to us.${prompt}
Though there is much yet to be learned, our research has revealed that ${item-singular: 0[2]} may be used to bolster your equipment, if attached in a proper manner.${prompt}
Mind you, ${item-singular: 0[2]} is not easy to come by, and I can offer no clues as to where or how to obtain it.
Should you be fortunate enough to come across some in your travels, however, I encourage you to explore its potential.${prompt}
Synergy is not a discipline for the faint of heart or mind, but with dedication and cooperation, there are great rewards to be reaped.
May your career as a synergist prove fruitful!${prompt}
First, you'll be wanting to check your fewell supply.
You may do so by speaking with a synergy engineer such as myself, or by examining a synergy furnace.${prompt}
You'll be needing at least one unit of fewell for each element dictated by your recipe.
Without this, even the most skilled synergist cannot hope to succeed.${prompt}
Should your fewell supply be in order, it's time to proceed with the synergy.
If you are using one of these public synergy furnaces here, you'll need to examine it and lay claim to its use.${prompt}
You may then deposit your ingredients. Should they correspond to a proper recipe, the synergy furnace will fire up automatically.
Note that as a safety precaution, the furnace will not activate if the recipe is beyond your level of synergy skill.${prompt}
From here, it becomes a race against the clock!
Through skilled operation of the synergy furnace, you must achieve the elemental balance prescribed by the recipe before the furnace's durability fails.${prompt}
Fortunately, synergy furnaces are outfitted with a wide array of features designed to aid the synergist in this demanding task.
First, you'll want to confirm the current balance of elements within the furnace and compare it to your desired result.${prompt}
Next, you can begin to ${color: 5}feed fewell${color: 1} into the furnace to gradually raise the level of elemental concentration.
Feeding fewell into the furnace until the required elemental balance is achieved is the most fundamental operation of synergy.${prompt}
However, high concentrations of elemental power can lead to volatile and unpredictable reactions.
Simply adding fewell haphazardly without making the necessary adjustments is a recipe for only one thing, and that's disaster.${prompt}

If you sense that the furnace is on the verge of elemental overload, you'll want to employ the ${color: 5}safety lever${color: 1} and ${color: 5}pressure handle${color: 1} to prevent an unfortunate accident from occurring.${prompt}
You'll also want to mind the laws of elemental ascendancy and opposition.
Increasing the concentration of a particular element will cause its counterpart to decrease.${prompt}
The furnace cannot sustain its power indefinitely, and will gradually lose durability as the synergy process continues.
You'll need to perform periodic ${color: 5}furnace repair${color: 1} should the furnace near its breaking point.${prompt}
It is also possible to ${color: 5}recycle strewn fewell${color: 1} during synergy.
While this will not impact the success or failure of the process itself, it will result in a greater amount of salvageable cinder produced as a by-product.${prompt}
This cinder is of great interest to our researchers back at the institute.
As such, we have introduced a reward system through which quality samples can be traded in for an assortment of synergy-related wares.${prompt}
As marvelous an apparatus as the synergy furnace may be, keep in mind that the technology is still in its infancy, and highly unstable.
There may be times when accidents occur despite the best efforts of the synergist.${prompt}
For your safety, we recommend stepping as far away from the furnace as possible at the first sign of danger.
Some synergists claim that giving the furnace a good thwack is also effective in preventing such accidents, but this is pure madness, if you ask me!${prompt}
You will also find that there are numerous techniques that can be applied to make the synergy procedure go even more smoothly.${prompt}
In many cases, expertise and knowledge acquired through crafting will serve you in synergy as well.
To truly master synergy, one must master crafting as well.${prompt}
Now let us return to the synergy process itself.
As your elemental balance approaches that prescribed by the recipe, the furnace will signal you, and you may retrieve your finished product.${prompt}
If the furnace is still holding strong at this time, you may choose to keep working to achieve an even closer balance.
The closer you come to the ideal balance, the higher the quality of your finished product will be.${prompt}
Indeed, many synergy masters consider these waning moments after the signal to be the time to really show off their skills!
Why, if they manage to achieve an elemental surge...${prompt}
What's an elemental surge, you ask?
Why, it's a miraculous phenomenon that occurs rarely--ever so rarely--upon feeding the furnace fewell.${prompt}

The elements react just in the right way, creating a miraculous reaction that brings the level of elemental concentration to exactly the desired level. Truly a boon from the Goddess for any synergist, no?${prompt}
...And that is the synergy process in a nutshell.
There's quite a bit of information to take in, so don't hesitate to return any time for a refresher course.${prompt}
Much like synthesis, to fashion items through synergy, you will need to follow a recipe.
We synergy engineers are always unearthing new recipes, and are happy to share with you those suitable for your level of skill.${prompt}
Unlike synthesis, however, a synergy recipe is more than just a list of ingredients.
There is also a required elemental balance that must be attained to achieve your desired result.${prompt}

Simple recipes involve only small doses of a limited number of elements, but more complex ones require the synergist to skillfully juggle wide ranges of elements in extremely high concentrations.${prompt}
The ingredients, you will have to remember on your own.
The required elemental balance, however, may be reviewed at any time during the synergy process by observing the readings on the synergy furnace.${prompt}

In particular, recipes through which the curious substance known as ${item-singular: 0[2]} can be attached to equipment are creating quite a buzz among synergistically inclined adventurers these days.${prompt}
${lettercase: 1}${item-singular: 0[2]} cannot be attached directly.
First, equipment must be prepared by etching an aperture into which an elementally compatible piece of ${item-singular: 0[2]} can then be embedded.${prompt}
The type of aperture that may be etched will depend on the piece of equipment.
There are also pieces of equipment that, alas, may not be modified at all.${prompt}
If you are curious what manner of aperture may be etched into a particular piece of equipment, you need only trade it to me or one of my colleagues.${prompt}
As a general rule, the higher the level of the item in question, the more difficult the synergy process for creating an aperture will be.${prompt}
You will find that certain pieces of equipment may be etched with multiple apertures.
It is, however, only possible to create one aperture at a time.${prompt}
Etching requires the use of a corrosive substance we call mordant.
Deposit mordant into a synergy furnace along with your equipment, and the process will begin.${prompt}
My colleagues and I have a stock of mordant available for sale.
The best way to learn is to practice, so if you're curious, we encourage you to purchase some and begin experimenting!${prompt}
The difficulty of the synergy process when embedding evolith is decided by a number of factors.${prompt}
Such factors include the variety of aperture and evolith, as well as the quantity of evolith you seek to attach.
Embedding the first piece is not too difficult a task, but the second and third pieces will not go in so easily.${prompt}
To begin the embedding process, deposit your evolith into the synergy furnace along with a piece of equipment with a compatible aperture.${prompt}
When etching or embedding, the required elemental balance may be confirmed at any time during the synergy process, so let this be your guide.${prompt}
Should you ever wish to remove any apertures and embedded evolith from a piece of equipment entirely, you may do so with an ingredient we call ${color: 5}revertant${color: 1}.${prompt}
Toss the revertant in a synergy furnace along with your equipment, and its potent powers will restore your item to a pure and pristine state!
Be warned, however, that embedded evolith will be lost forever in the process.${prompt}
As you are no doubt already aware, synergy makes use of a highly combustible form of elemental crystals that we call “fewell.”
The more complex the recipe, the greater the quantity of fewell required.${prompt}
Veteran synergists know well the hassle of having to constantly monitor their fewell supply and procure crystals to replenish depleted stock.${prompt}
To free you of such trifling burdens and allow you to focus your mind entirely on your art, we synergy engineers are offering a convenient fewell replenishment service!${prompt}
For a nominal fee calculated based upon the current state of your fewell reserves, we will instantly refill you to full capacity.${prompt}
That's right--all elements in one simple transaction, directly to your ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}!
What could be easier?${prompt}
Looking to fire up your furnace and enter the world of ${item-singular: 0[2]}?
If so, you've come to the right place!${prompt}
We're proud to offer a supply of the corrosive agent known as ${color: 5}mordant${color: 1} for sale.
With this, synergy newcomers can hone their skills and outfit their equipment with evolith-capable apertures in the process.${prompt}
Mind you, our stock is limited to only the most diluted, readily produced form of the stuff.
You'll find that it only has the strength to etch items of relatively low level.${prompt}
Etching high-powered equipment requires the use of more concentrated and potent forms of mordant.
As quantities are limited, we can offer these only in exchange for cinder.${prompt}
Ah, synergy techniques!
Those handy tricks of the trade that can mean the difference between a shiny new item and a major furnace meltdown.${prompt}
My colleagues and I are always eager to train fellow synergists in a wide range of techniques.
We can't do it all, though--you'll need to hone your synergy skill in order to benefit from our instruction.${prompt}
Bear in mind that certain techniques can only be imparted to students possessing specialized crafting knowledge.
For example, only skilled smiths will be able to comprehend the method for more efficient fewell feeding.${prompt}
Accomplished goldsmiths will be able to observe the inner workings of the furnace and stave off potential accidents.
You will find that all crafting skills--even those you may not expect--may be applied in some way to support the synergy process.${prompt}
Word has it that there are also pieces of equipment that can impart hidden synergy techniques to the wearer.
These, too, are said to be only accessible to skilled crafters.${prompt}
The moral of the story is this: while synergy skill is important, neglect not your other crafting skills.
To become a true synergy master, finding the proper balance is key.${prompt}
Synergy remains a young discipline, and researchers back at the institute are burning the midnight fewell in the hopes of uncovering the next breakthrough in our field.${prompt}
Research of late is centered around the cinder that is left behind as a by-product of each synergy operation.
Their composition, it would seem, has much to teach us of the true nature of the complex elemental reactions that go on within the bellies of these furnaces.${prompt}
We've even instituted a reward program for adventurers willing to contribute prime samples in the name of science.${prompt}
It would be no exaggeration to say that, to us, cinder is worth more than its weight in gold!
Bring it to me or my colleagues--preferably in large quantities--and you're sure to be pleased at what we can offer you in return.${prompt}

Mandragora Mania is a game in which you battle for jingly by moving your mandragora pieces to the goal.${prompt}
Your goal is the ${choice: 0}[red/blue/green] one on the right, while your opponent's is the ${choice: 0}[blue/green/red] one on the left.${prompt}
At the start of the game, three mandragoras each will be placed on the eight game areas, excluding the goal.${prompt}
There are five starting placements (A through E), and you are able to select which one you would like to employ. The default setting is "Random."${prompt}
This explanation uses pattern A, but the basic rules are the same regardless of the starting pattern.${prompt}

The three ${choice: 0}[red/blue/green] areas in front of you are yours,${wait-36: 2}the three ${choice: 0}[blue/green/red] areas at the back are your opponent's,${wait-36: 2}and the remaining two are neutral.${prompt}
You must choose one area--either yours or a neutral one--to proceed.${prompt}
The areas are numbered from one to five starting from the left, and any mandragoras in the area you select will move.${prompt}
Conversely, your opponent must select either a neutral area or an area that belongs to them.${prompt}
From the right, those areas are numbered 6, 4, 7, 2, and 8.${prompt}
For example, if you select Area 1,${wait-36: 4}one mandragora will move to Area 2${wait-36: 1}and one will move to Area 3,${wait-36: 1}and one will move to Area 4.${prompt}
Note that the mandragoras will move from the back first--last in, first out.${prompt}
You will receive points known as “jingly” each time one of your mandragoras reaches the goal.${prompt}
You will enter your opponent's territory whenever you go past the goal.${prompt}

If one of your mandragoras happens to reach the opponent's goal, the goal will be pushed back and your mandragora will return to your own area. You don't have to worry about your mandragora earning any jingly for your opponent.${prompt}
The order in which players choose areas will be determined based on your turn settings. The default setting is random.${prompt}
This explanation has skipped past your opponent's turn for demonstration purposes, but in the actual game you and your opponent will take turns choosing areas.${prompt}
However, if the last mandragora to move reaches the goal, you will get to take an additional turn.${prompt}
Mandragoras are a very diverse species, and the amount of jingly you earn is determined by the species of mandragora that crosses into the goal.${prompt}
Adenium and citrullus: 3 jingly (first player)/4 jingly (second player).${prompt}
Korrigan and pachypodium: 2 jingly (first player)/3 jingly (second player).${prompt}
Standard mandragoras: 1 jingly (both players).${prompt}
The game is over when either you or your opponent no longer has any mandragoras that can move.${prompt}
The player who has the most jingly at that point will be declared the winner.${prompt}
The key to victory lies in taking advantage of the various mandragora subspecies bonuses while claiming multiple turns in a row.${prompt}
